newsitem.title: CHINA: China interbank market rates (CHIBOR) mixed.
newsitem.headline: China interbank market rates (CHIBOR) mixed.

text.p: Following is the China Interbank Offered Rate (CHIBOR) for Friday issued by the official Xinhua news agency on behalf of the People's Bank of China, the central bank.
The figures represent weighted averages and not closing prices and are annual percentage rates.
Volume rose sharply to 2.4 billion yuan from 1.1 billion on Thursday, with the seven-day contract the most active.
Traders said prices moved more widely in active trading than earlier this week, with some state banks winding up their positions on the approach of the year-end.
But there was a rough balance of demand and supply of short-term funds on the market, making the weighted averages of most contracts move in a tight range, they said.

Borrowing came mainly from short-term financial centres, money brokerages run by the central bank, in particular those from Guangdong, Hainan and Jiangsu provinces, they said. Some foreign banks also borrowed money on the market, they said.
Traders expect the rates to change little next week.
